intro: Cristobalia, commonly known as the coral tree, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive, showy inflorescences that resemble clusters of coral, hence its common name. The plants typically have palmate leaves and produce capsules as fruits. They are native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. Cristobalia species are often cultivated for their ornamental value and are sometimes used in traditional medicine.
